column1: # There were two gauges running in parallel for 1889 and 1893-1896.
# In 1889 a Snowdon gauge was introduced, and from then on formed the main record for the site.
# The location information on the sheets is contradictory about whether the gauge is in [Great] Driffield or Little Driffield.
# The sheet titles all refer to Driffield York Road, and the census gives 3 York Road as the observer address.
# With York Road being in Driffield rather than Little Driffield.
# But the church directions on the sheet mention Little Driffield church explicitly, and so put the gauge on the eastern edge of Little Driffield.
# Grid references for the two locations are: TA020581 (York Road) and TA012580 (Little Driffield), about 1km to the west.
# Based on the directions, the Little Driffield site is assumed to be where the gauge was located, and its grid reference has been used.
